line_1: So, Sir, with this Epistolary Scroll,
line_2: Receive the Partner of my inmost Soul:

line_1: Spread then, historic Muse, thy pictur'd scroll;
line_2: And rouse to thought sublime th' exulting soul.

line_1: While heaven and earth, seem one black, formless scroll,
line_2: It is an hour of darkness, when the soul,

line_1: And willingly I close the deep ensanguin'd scroll.
line_2: Dark storms his genial powers controul,

line_1: The windings of the awful scroll,
Would seem a spotless scanty scroll,
And burn it, like an useless parchment Scroll:
line_2: Yet if He wills, may change or spoil the whole;

line_1: And burn it, like an useless parchment Scroll:
line_2: May take yon' beauteous, mystic, starry Roll,

line_1: And heav'n is all departed as a scroll:
line_2: But these shall last when night has quench'd the pole,
